sentence.Network_en: One can habituate oneself to living alone, though rarely with any pleasure.
sentence.Network_cn: 虽然独自一人生活很少会有乐趣,但还是可以习惯的.

sentence.Network_en: You must habituate yourself to hard work.
sentence.Network_cn: 你必须使自己习惯于艰苦的工作.

sentence.Network_en: According to my ancient love manual, I habituate to a extraordinary and humor man.
sentence.Network_cn: 根据我的古老爱恋手册显示, 我习惯与众不同且幽默的男子.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from late Latin habituat- 'accustomed', from the verb habituare, from habitus (see habit)

means.word_mean: 2. make psychologically or physically used (to something);

sentences.sentence: "She became habituated to the background music"

stems_affixes.word_buile: habit居住,习惯+ual……的→adj.习惯性的,惯常的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 无人居住的,杳无人迹的

stems_affixes.word_buile: habit居住,习惯→住一个地方→习惯了
habit居住,习惯+at表示地方→住的地方
inhabit[v.居住于,存在于;栖息于]+ant人→n.居民,住户
co共同+habit居住→共同住一个地方
habit居住,习惯+u+ate表动词→v.使习惯于
in进入,里面+habit居住,习惯→住里面

sentences.en: One can habituate oneself to living alone, though rarely with any pleasure.
sentences.cn: 虽然独自一人生活很少会有乐趣，但还是可以习惯的。

sentences.en: They are habituated to hard work.
sentences.cn: 他们习惯于艰苦的工作。

sentences.en: From his childhood, Jack has habituated himself to getting up early.
sentences.cn: 杰克从小就习惯于早起。
